bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Frank T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

An order having been entered herein on September 30, 1915, allowing an apeal in the above entitled cause to the Supreme Court of the United States adn no certificate of probable cause having been issued at said time, and counsel for the respective parties having stipulted that said certificate may now be issued and transmitted to the Supreme Court of the United States, and the Court having considered said matter,

NOW, THEREFORE, I, Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled Court, before whom said cause was tried and by whom a decision therein was rendered on September 23, 1915, do hereby certify in accordance with the Act of Congress of March 10, 1908, (35 Stat.L40) that there is probable cause for the allowance of said appeal.
DONE in open Court this 4th day of August September 1917, as of September 30, 1915, nunc pro tunc.
div1.ab: Jeremiah Neterer District Judge and the presiding Judge before whom said cause was heard.
OK. Alfred H. Lundin Caldwell Frank P. Helsell
div1.p: LAW OFFICES CASSIUS E. GATES L. C. SMITH BUILDING, SEATTLE
